item.title: Java Arrays Explained
item.description: What are arrays? Think of arrays like a row of cardboard boxes. These boxes can be used to store different types of data - ints, Strings, even custom data types like Person. One important thing to note is that you can only have a constant number of these boxes for each array you make. While making the array, if you tell Java that this array will have 10 items, then that array will always be able to contain upto 10 items - no more, no less, no changes to this size.
